author: chucklu
body:
Hi,
    Since we have get-service,start-service,and some other functions about windows service.
    Is it possible to add intall-service and uninstall-service?
   
 I am using installutil.exe tool to do the installation and uninstallation.
    sometimes, the uninstallation did not work.
```
installutil /u 
```
   

   then I need to switch to cmd prompt,and use 
```
 sc delete
```

   If you can support install and uninstall service,it will be great.

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.0-beta
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-beta.6
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.10586
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: chucklu
comments.body: By the way, when the installutil.exe /u did not work. It is something like [this](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/13608157/installutil-wont-uninstall-the-specified-service-does-not-exist-as-an-install).

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: There isn't a `Remove-Service`.  If needed, it would be an enhancement.

comments.author: chucklu
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT  Would you add remove-service to an enhancement list?

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @chucklu I've updated the title of this to reflect the ask, currently no plans to implement this

comments.author: chucklu
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT  Thanks,I wish you guys can implement it  in the future.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body:
@chucklu workaround for now:

```powershell
get-ciminstance win32_service -filter "name='yourservicename'" | remove-ciminstance
```

comments.author: chucklu
comments.body:
@SteveL-MSFT  thanks,I also find the command in powershell [doc](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/microsoft.powershell.management/new-service?view=powershell-6)
```powershell
PS C:\> sc.exe delete TestService
- or -
PS C:\> (Get-WmiObject win32_service -Filter "name='TestService'").delete()
```
It's not convenient, if you can support _Remove-Service_, it would be great.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Get-WmiObject is deprecated and replaced by Get-CimInstance

title: REQ: Remove-Service cmdlet
